e4: Switching to the new policy aligns financial reporting with ethical business practices, carrying long-term benefits in legally safeguarding the company, improving transparency, and building a truthful relationship with both retail and institutional investors. This diminishes inconsistencies that arise from human-based adjustments, strengthening company stewardship and regulatory compliance.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, objectivity, and accuracy, avoiding intentional biases or misleading representations of financial performance. It should facilitate fair access to information for all investors, fostering accountability and compliance with regulatory standards. Considerations include the impact on investor trust, legal duties, and equitable treatment of minor stakeholders and retail investors.
e6: What specific strategies will the management team take to communicate policy changes to ensure all investor groups, including retail investors, fully understand the shifts?
